intro: Schiedea wichmanii, commonly known as the Maui mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Maui. Schiedea wichmanii is a perennial shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected under Hawaiian conservation laws.
